title_sort: walt whitman to john fraser, 27 november 1878
title: Walt Whitman to John Fraser, 27 November 1878
text: 431 Stevens StreetCamden New JerseyU S AmericaNovNovember 27 '78Dear SirMr Child tells me you would like a piece from me for the Tobacco Plant. Will this do? The price is $12—(? two pounds eight shilshillings)—If you print it I hope you have a good proof reader, & that he will be very particular with it—Walt WhitmanAlso please send me three copies, & direct a copy each toWm M Rosetti 56 Euston Sq London n wThos: Dixon 15 Sunderland st. SunderlandProf: Edward Dowden, Temple Rd. Winsted, Rathmines, DublinRafe Leycester, Toft, Knutsford, Country CheshireEdward Carpenter, 45 Brunswick Sq. BrightonJ A Symonds, Clifton Hill House, BristolRobt Buchanan, Editor Light, LondonAlfred Tennyson, Eaton Square, LondonJ Leicester Warren, 67 Onslow Sq: London s wP S—I am not an anti-tobacconist—On the contrary have seen how important & valuable the sedative was in the extensive military hospitals of our Secession war—Still I do not smoke or chew myself—Sometimes wish I did smoke now in my old age & invalidism—but it is too late to learn—But my brothers & all my near friends are smokers, & I am accustomed to it—live among smokers, & always carry cigars in my pocket to give special friends who prize them— Walt Whitman to John Fraser, 27 November 1878
